availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Marshall Webb (Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and notary public)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and notary public. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Married to Ellen Webb. Father of Mary Webb, Jackson Webb, and Lucy Webb. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Notary public in Trimble County in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 4; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 1; Find A Grave, "William Marshall Webb (1805-1881)," Memorial #22516477, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=22516477&ref=acom (accessed March 31, 2017).
